result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: filed by PD's Office appointing Atty Dolfi. bph

The original document was titled: pretrial assessment
The original history event date is: 08-02-2022

01:04 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Carrie Mae Hickman. Defendant Carrie Mae Hickman in court, in custody. Includes 22CM159 RW/INIT and 22CF521 INIT. Court reviews case. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE does qualify for PD. Enter NG plea in case 22CM159. Bond argument. Court orders bond in both files. Quash warrant. Court sets PSC and SETC. Adjourned
Settlement conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Includes 22CM159 and 22CF521.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, All Walmart Locations and S.R.B. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference on September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
